Yes, here are some examples of technological tools or software designed for neurodiverse individuals and their impact:

1. Brain Power - this software is designed primarily for autistic individuals, helping them develop social and cognitive skills using 3D animation, augmented reality, and other interactive tools.

2. Filisia - a language-learning app designed to be inclusive of different learning styles, using visual, auditory, and kinesthetic techniques. It is ideal for individuals with dyslexia, ADHD, and other related learning disabilities.

3. Aumi - an app designed to help individuals with autism better manage their daily schedules and activities. It uses visual and audio reminders, as well as customizable routines that suit the individual's needs.

4. Focus@Will - this software uses neuroscience to boost productivity by providing suitable background music for different cognitive functions. It is ideal for individuals with ADHD, who often struggle to concentrate for extended periods.

5. Avaz - a communication app designed for individuals with speech and language difficulties, such as those with autism or cerebral palsy. It uses a picture-based communication system, enabling individuals to communicate effectively and express their needs and emotions.
